contentrichtext.text: {{about|the outdoor stadium in Shanghai|the indoor stadium|Shanghai Indoor Stadium}} {{Infobox Stadium | stadium_name = YUAN SHEN SPORTS CENTER<br>源深体育中心体育场 | image = | location = [[Shanghai]], [[China]]| opened = 2000 | owner = | surface = Grass | seating_capacity = 20,000 (max), 16,000 (football) | tenants = [[Shanghai Shenxin F.C.]] }}'''Yuanshen Sports Centre Stadium''' ([[Simplified Chinese]]: 源深体育中心体育场) is a [[multi-purpose stadium]] in [[Shanghai]], [[China]]. It is currently used mostly for [[football (soccer)|football]] matches. The stadium holds 20,000.<ref>http://www.tuniu.com/places/24752</ref> ==Events== * ''[[Super Show 2 Tour|2nd Asia Tour - "Super Show 2"]]'' - [[South Korean]] boy band [[Super Junior]] - 18 October 2009 and the official opening performance of the ''11th Shanghai International Art Festival'', hosted by China's Ministry of Culture.<ref>[http://www.asiae.co.kr/news/view.htm?idxno=2009101915544749505 "Super Junior wraps up Shanghai concert in success"] ''Asiae'' 19 October 2009. Retrieved 2012-04-17</ref> * On April 19, 2008 the arena hosted Japanese rock band [[L'Arc~en~Ciel]] as part of their "TOUR 2008 L'7 ~Trans ASIA via PARIS~"<ref>http://www.setlist.fm/setlist/larcenciel/2008/yuanshen-sports-stadium-shanghai-china-43d66fbb.html</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{coord|31|14|0.33|N|121|31|54.06|E|type:landmark_scale:3000|display=title}} {{Shanghai|state=expanded}} [[Category:Football venues in China]] [[Category:Sports venues in Shanghai]] [[Category:Multi-purpose stadiums in China]] {{PRChina-sports-venue-stub}}
